Name: True Colors
QuestDesc:
On the way to the Pioneer Association for new tasks, you received a sudden call from Zhezhi, saying that she was summoned to appear at a dispute hearing...
What is the purpose of this hearing, and what's the story behind it? Caught up in a struggle of consciousness, will this artist being tried find the courage to reconnect with her emotions and talents, and continue to breathe new life into her paintings?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, it's almost time for the dispute hearing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I still hope you'll come with me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't mean to burden you, but if you'd like to come, please meet me at the Public Security Bureau entrance.

Chapters.Title: Meet up with Zhezhi at the Public Security Bureau

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't expect such a big crowd at the hearing...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... S-should I take the stand myself? What do you think, little kitty?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, maybe we can do a little show of... um... paws. Raise your left paw if you think I should testify, or your right paw if...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-wait! You raised your left paw before I even finished my sentence... No, that doesn't count. Let's try again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, if you raise your right paw, I'll... let someone else handle it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... right paw, huh? Well... I did actually want to tell everyone the truth myself. Let's give this another shot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Juyao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ms. Zhezhi, the hearing is about to start. If you would, please join us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now? Y-yes, Madam Juyao! I... I'll be there in a minute!

Options.PlotLineKey: Hi, Zhezhi. I've made it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, oh, you're here! It's... it's really nice to see you! And... I appreciate you coming.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just handed over all the evidence we gathered from Mingyan's studio and the Exile's camp to the Patrollers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now the Shanyun Art Exchange can't deny the fact they were producing and trading art forgeries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... there is one more thing. The Patroller said we still need someone to testify in the hearing.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you want me to testify?
You can do this. I believe in you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're really kind, but... um, I'll be fine to do this myself. You've already helped me so much, even just having you here is a huge relief.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some things, I've got to face on my own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That said... I, uh, didn't... didn't expect there would be so many spectators coming to watch...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I get nervous and mess up any details, could you please help to remind me?

Options.PlotLineKey: No problem.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you! Having you here helps, more than you know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's about time. We should probably go in, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eh? B-but... I've... I've never spoken in front of so many people before...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: H-how about... you do the talking, and, um, I'll add details... if, if I have to?

Options.PlotLineKey: You know this case better than I do.
Actually, I kind of forgot the details...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We wouldn't want my lack of artistic expertise to give the Shanyun Art Exchange a chance to turn the hearing against us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're right... Then... I'll... I'll do it myself...

Options.PlotLineKey: Relax, I'll be here if you need me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, I've got your back. Just remember, you're the only one who can lay out the truth—the whole truth— for everyone to see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...You're right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was the one who chose to uncover the truth behind this case. I can't back down now, not when it matters most.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll give it my all, I promise. Let's go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You meet Zhezhi at the entrance of the Public Security Bureau. Relieved to see you, she gathers her courage and decides to speak the truth about the art forgery case during the hearing.

Chapters.Title: Enter the Public Security Bureau with Zhezhi

Dialogues.Speaker: Juyao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With both parties present, this hearing is now in session. Let us begin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Juyao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: First, a brief overview of the case before us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Juyao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ms. Zhezhi alleges that the guilty party, Mingyan, implicated in the Tacet Discord Assault, was coerced into committing art fraud under duress.

Dialogues.Speaker: Juyao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Therefore, her mental state was adversely affected, which led to her committing actions contrary to her will.

Dialogues.Speaker: Juyao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Today, based on new evidence provided by Ms. Zhezhi and the result of this hearing, we will determine whether to revisit Mingyan's charges and consider if the Shanyun Art Exchange is indeed guilty of selling illegal art forgeries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What?! With all due respect, this doesn't match what we discussed before!

Dialogues.Speaker: Juyao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Baici, I remind you that any evidence or arguments presented before and during the hearing are valid.

Dialogues.Speaker: Juyao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you would like to add further information, you are welcome to do so at any point.

Dialogues.Speaker: Juyao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, without further ado, either party may begin their opening statement.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madam Juyao, th-the situation is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madam Juyao, as the head of the Shanyun Art Exchange, I, Baici, must clear our name and seek justice here today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are two points I'd like to address. Firstly, the authenticity of our artworks remains unimpeachable. Secondly, Mingyan's provocative creations stem solely from her own greed and vanity. She alone should bear responsibility for the assault.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Throughout my tenure at the Art Exchange, our foremost principle has been that of integrity, a well known fact. And yet...

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Integrity in business is not enough to stave off discord.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We are aware of certain painters, rejected by the Art Exchange, nursing grudges, and resorting to threats...

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They bombarded us with spite and slander, causing a public uproar simply because they didn't get what they wanted.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should the public be swayed by these slanderous insinuations, that paint us as wicked fraudsters, then I'm afraid justice will never be served!

Dialogues.Speaker: Juyao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please control yourself, Mr. Baici.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forgive me, Madam, but if this injustice persists, I will have no choice but to sue them for harming the Shanyun Art Exchange's reputation. They have damaged the trust we built with our clients!

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I demand they compensate us for our losses and issue a public apology!

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such disgraceful behavior will not diminish us! Our principles will not waver, and we will protect the Shanyun Art Exchange from any ill intent!

Options.PlotLineKey: He's actually blaming the victim now...
He's trying to change the topic...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've bought paintings from Shanyun Art Exchange before. They were good quality, and their service was decent. Hard to believe they'd be involved in something like this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Woyun
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The honest always get the short end of the stick... But who's Mingyan? A painter? Never heard of them...

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianzhang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tsk, must be some nobody trying to get attention using the Shanyun's name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuqing
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why is the Art Exchange always in the middle of some controversy?

Dialogues.Speaker: Juyao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Order! Order!

Dialogues.Speaker: Juyao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You may continue your statement.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madam, allow us to present our account of the events.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This all really began three days ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was entrusted to investigate a certain "Arcane Artist" in the Tiger's Maw.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the hearing unfolds, Baici, the founder of the Shanyun Art Exchange, casts doubt on Zhezhi's statement with his slippery arguments. Nervous and shaken, Zhezhi finds it impossible to refute him. You decide to step in and explain the events of three days ago. Your support gives Zhezhi the confidence to continue, and she uses her paintbrush to paint an image of the scene.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gupan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, Rover! Took you long enough to get here!

Options.PlotLineKey: So you were the one who ordered this task.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gupan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Things are getting awfully strange around the mine lately. Figured you're just the one to untangle this mess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gupan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With your knack for solving mysteries, you'll figure this out in no time!

Options.PlotLineKey: What happened?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gupan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know if you've ever heard of it, but there's a special folktale in Jinzhou...

Dialogues.Speaker: Gupan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Word has it, there's this mysterious Arcane Artist whose paintings come to life as they paint, as if each brushstroke has a life of its own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gupan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once their canvas dries, whatever they've painted leaps right off the page. Mythical creatures, the whole shebang—all real as day!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gupan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The thing is, anyone who might've seen these paintings? Well, they vanish into thin air...

Options.PlotLineKey: What does the mine have to do with all of this?
Sounds like a Forte to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gupan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've never heard of such unique Forte.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gupan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lately, I've been receiving reports about eerie monsters wandering the mine at midnight. Some witnesses even ran into them more than once!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gupan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These monsters, they look like paintings from a distance. But approach them and they're as docile as can be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gupan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Reading these reports, I couldn't shake the tale of the Arcane Artist from my mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gupan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure, some say it's just a prank or some new Tacet Discord variant...

Dialogues.Speaker: Gupan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But with rumors swirling, folks are getting jittery. Can't let things escalate. That's why I reached out to you.

Options.PlotLineKey: Let me take it from here.
Good pay, good service.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gupan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great! Counting on you to crack this case wide open.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gupan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Deal! I'll pay whatever it takes to keep the goosebumps coming. I can't wait for you to uncover the truth!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gupan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and you might want to chat up the witnesses. Got their names right here for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Three days earlier, Gupan had entrusted you with investigating the "Arcane Artist" in the Tiger's Maw. You then decide to track down witnesses and begin gathering information.

Dialogues.Speaker: Huaijin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's it for today. Time for a break! Oh, hey there. Need something?

Options.PlotLineKey: Tell me about the recent event at the mine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Huaijin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've come to the right guy. I was actually the first to see those weird things.

Dialogues.Speaker: Huaijin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was playing chess with the old miners until midnight, then headed home alone. On my way back, I heard these strange moans, like some kind of monster was out there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Huaijin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At first, I thought they were Tacet Discords and I was ready to bolt. But then I realized they were different. These monsters... they were being drawn to something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Huaijin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Curiosity got the better of me, so I took a step closer...

Dialogues.Speaker: Huaijin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...And saw that they had these strange features. Gleaming eyes, gnarled horns, and dark green bodies covered in slimy liquid...

Options.PlotLineKey: Could it be a new variant of TD?
Could it be a prank?
Could it be related to the Arcane Artist?

Dialogues.Speaker: Huaijin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, maybe... But unlike Tacet Discords, they didn't attack me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Huaijin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No way... Those monsters showed up in an empty field at midnight, so there was no one around to prank. Besides, what's the point of tricks if there's no one to see them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Huaijin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you think they're related? Did Gupan tell you about that old folktale?

Dialogues.Speaker: Huaijin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know, I did see some people standing nearby. Just some shadows, really, 'cause it was so dim.

Dialogues.Speaker: Huaijin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The light was flickering in the wind, so I couldn't make out their faces. But I knew something was weird with the scrolls they had in their hands. Every time they moved, more monsters appeared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Huaijin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Later, I told everyone about it, and Gupan was there. She freaked out, saying it was just like the tale of the Arcane Artist.

Options.PlotLineKey: They? There was more than one person on the scene that night?

Dialogues.Speaker: Huaijin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not sure... but I overheard them talking. No, actually, "arguing" would be more accurate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Huaijin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, I got worried those monsters might attack me, so I bolted and didn't catch what they were arguing about...

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you remember where you saw them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Huaijin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I do remember... Wait, you're not seriously thinking of going there, are you? Whatever those monsters are, they're unidentified and dangerous. If you have to go, be really careful, alright?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huaijin reveals that the monsters lurking around the mine have been acting strangely, and hints that they might be linked to some painting scrolls. Huaijin also warns you that there is likely more than one person involved in the case.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jifeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh... You don't look like you work at the mine. Can I help you with something?

Options.PlotLineKey: Tell me about the recent event at the mine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jifeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh yes, that strange event. It's the talk of the town right now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jifeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've conducted several investigations and found that those monsters tend to appear around midnight. Their locations seem random, though.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jifeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fortunately, they haven't caused much harm. I think it's because they always show up and vanish in the dead of night.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jifeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you ask me, these monsters are a new type of Tacet Discord. Since they're unrecorded, our Terminal can't trigger an alarm when they're nearby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jifeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For safety reasons, we have increased our patrols around the mine.

Options.PlotLineKey: Did you notice anything else unusual?
Could it be related to the Arcane Artist?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jifeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anything else unusual? Hmm... Yes there was one thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jifeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you mean the mysterious painter who can bring fantastical creatures to life? That could explain it, but a Forte tied to painting is rare.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jifeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aside from the blurred silhouettes I saw that night, I remember hearing voices—like people talking.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jifeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The voices came from where those silhouettes were, but they sounded like... vague muttering.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jifeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thinking about it now, if it was a human voice, how could someone get so close to those monsters without crying out for help?

Options.PlotLineKey: I see. Thank you for the information.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jifeng elaborates on more key details of the attacks, leading you to suspect that they are not random events, but something far more deliberate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Miner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You see my arm here? The monsters mauled me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Miner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard laughter, voices with them. Will there be half-human Tacet Discords? Like... hybrids?

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Miner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stop. You're giving me the chills...

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Miner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stop being so paranoid. Remember last time, when that guy was collecting laundry on a skateboard and you thought it was a ghost? You need to calm down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What, a new urban legend? Man, our mine is really cool...

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 2
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What urban legend?

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Miner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our mine is full of urban legends and strange stories. Strange comm message from a mysterious train? A certain survey team's bizzare discoveries underground? And now, a new tale has surfaced!

Dialogues.Speaker: Curious Miner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What urban legend?

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Miner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: About the Arcane Artist, of course! A legendary tale with paintings, monsters, and humans? I can already smell the suspense and surprises.

Dialogues.Speaker: Curious Miner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is it about, exactly?

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Miner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a fascinating place! So much character and charm. I must write down this story right away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Curious Miner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait. What on earth happened?

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. The paintings came first, then the monsters and humans followed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 2
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. The humans came first, then the monsters and paintings followed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 3
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. The monsters ARE the humans.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've been seeing her around here often.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 2
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She said she's here for inspiration.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 3
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I bet she's hiding from something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wasn't someone standing there with the painter before it happened?

Dialogues.Speaker: Contemplating Onlooker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wasn't someone standing there with the painter before it happened?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chatting Onlooker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? Should we go tell the Patrollers about it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Contemplating Onlooker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe, but I don't even remember what that person looked like...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chatting Onlooker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Was that her partner in crime, maybe?

Dialogues.Speaker: Contemplating Onlooker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They were arguing over something... The painter looked ready to snap...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chatting Onlooker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That sounds concerning. We should tell the Patrollers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Contemplating Onlooker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, let's go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've gathered enough information. It's time to check the scene where those monsters were spotted.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's... something ahead...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That figure... that paintbrush... Could it be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing here. That's odd... Did I just imagine that?

Options.PlotLineKey: Zhezhi...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: R-rover? You're here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, did I scare you just now?

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm fine. Why are you here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...F-finding inspiration.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The night... often sparks my creativity...

Options.PlotLineKey: ...Don't tell me you are actually the Arcane Artist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course not!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I heard about the tale of the Arcane Artist and hoped to find out who they are...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry I lied to you, I just... didn't want to drag anyone else into this...

Options.PlotLineKey: You too? Why are you investigating this?
Are you also a ghost story enthusiast?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: N-no, I'm not into ghost stories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bringing painted creatures to life, making fantasies real—it sounds like a fairy tale, but when the Arcane Artist first caught people's attention in Jinzhou years ago, it was more than just a tale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now this story is making the rounds again. Most don't see the dangers it holds. As someone who feels the threat, I... I want to uncover the truth before it's too late.

Options.PlotLineKey: The Arcane Artist showed up before?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, there was once an artist who could create paintings that felt so real, you could almost step into them...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But these paintings, they strayed from the artist's original intentions and... caused a lot of trouble.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know who's behind these latest events, but if it's really the Arcane Artist... their paintings will bring nothing but trouble. T-that's why I... I have to stop them, to prevent the past from repeating itself...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unfortunately, I'm... not very good at investigating, so I haven't found any major clues yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm here for the Arcane Artist, but also hoping to meet an old acquaintance. Maybe he knows what happened in the mine...

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll go with you. It's linked to the case I'm investigating.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that so? O-ok.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While investigating sightings of the monsters and the Arcane Artist, you run into Zhezhi. She explains she is also investigating the chaos caused by the Arcane Artist. Realizing you are after the same thing, you suggest asking a local mineral merchant for more information.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, Zhezhi! Long time no see! You need more pigments already?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: N-no, not yet...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And this must be the Rover! Nice to meet you. Heard a lot about you. Didn't realize you and Zhezhi knew each other.

Options.PlotLineKey: We met during the Moon-Chasing Festival.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I've never had the chance to introduce myself properly...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great moment for it! Here's the thing, Rover. I can't say I know Zhezhi very well, but I do know she's got this quirk where her courage tends to crumble right when it's crunchtime.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, when it comes to introducing herself to you, I'd bet money on it she's been mentally rehearsing it for forever before she got the guts to take action.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, it's not like that!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zhezhi, you can't keep avoiding things! You've got to take action, or you'll never get what you want! You only live once, right?!

Options.PlotLineKey: That does make sense.
Well, that's a bit too much...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes... Mr. Shilang is right. Rover, I've actually been meaning to tell you something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello, my name is Zhezhi. We have met before, but I'd like to make this a formal request. I would really like for us to become friends!

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course, I'd be happy to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello? Zhezhi?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, what are you waiting for?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eh? I... um... Okay! I can do this!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Um... Rober...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (That was a pretty obvious slip of the tongue...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem! Nice to meet you, my name is Zhezhi. I'm... a painter. I take art commissions and strive to create beautiful paintings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I'm not being very articulate... b-but I hope we can be friends!

Options.PlotLineKey: Hello, I'm {PlayerName}.
We're already friends.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, how sweet! I must say, I've never seen Zhezhi this nervous since she first became one of my cherished patrons.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-wait, Mr. Shilang! We're actually here today to talk about the tale of the Arcane Artist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I know the tale, but I've never come across this mystical maestro myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If such an artist truly existed, I'd be the first to know, without a doubt!

Options.PlotLineKey: What makes you say that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I supply ore to pigment manufacturers, and sometimes serve as their sales proxy, so most painters in Jinzhou come to my shop to buy pigments.

Options.PlotLineKey: Anything suspicious about the pigment buyers?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... pigments aren't flying off the shelves these days. Just a few regulars, you know?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... but those ore buyers from a while back, they seemed a bit suspicious.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They bought heaps of leftover ore—the cheapest type—and told me not to let anyone know they got the ore here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People don't usually buy that stuff. Oh wait, Zhezhi, didn't you buy some once? A long time ago, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I remember you saying you couldn't afford the fancy pigments, so you made your own. That stuck with me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So when those guys asked for leftovers, I paid extra attention.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you sure you can tell us this? I thought they asked you to keep it a secret...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pft, they turned out to be thieves who stole from me during the night! When I found out, I reported the theft to the Patrollers and that was the end of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thieves don't deserve my business or respect.

Options.PlotLineKey: May I have a look at your transaction record?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shilang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. Help yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the merchant Shilang's encouragement, Zhezhi drums up the courage to ask to be your friend and is relieved by your response. To shift the conversation away from Shilang's friendly teasing, she mentions the Arcane Artist. You learn that some suspicious individuals had purchased heaps of leftover ore and even stole from Shilang at night. To confirm the details, you check Shilang's transaction records.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If this is the situation...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm? {PlayerName}? Hey! {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What brings you here? It's been ages since we last met! The Patrol Station's been pretty busy lately, so I haven't had the time to catch up with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And Zhezhi's here too! Hiya! Do you remember me? We met at the Moon-Chasing Festival.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? Are you alright? You don't look well... Do you need help?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: H-hello... No, it's not... uh... no, thank you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The painting we had you do for us during the festival is awesome! Everyone loves it, so we put it up on the wall!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? Hehe, I'm glad you all like it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'd also like to invite you to our station, so we can formally thank you in person!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, how bout' coming to the station with me today? Are you heading back to the city?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh... but we're still investig— I... O-okay.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you sure we can go now?
Wait, we have a case to investigate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, is this not a good time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Investigate? About what? A new case?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, about the Arcane Artist tale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I get it! In that case, it's probably not the best time for a get-together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's okay! Just tell me if you need any help!

Options.PlotLineKey: Thanks. But why are you here, Chixia?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm here to support the Patrollers. There was an assault near the mine recently, and they're short on people to investigate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's odd is those monsters haven't caused any more trouble since we got here. Right now, we're talking to witnesses and trying to figure out what triggered the incident.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did something just happen over there...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't tell me it's a Tacet Discord... Hold on, just got a message... Seems like they really are stirring up trouble again. Sorry, but I gotta go check this out!

Options.PlotLineKey: We'll go with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: S-should we go as well?

Options.PlotLineKey: Why not? Maybe we'll find some clues useful to our case.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You could be right, but there's one other thing...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your discussion is interrupted by Chixia's arrival. Zhezhi, feeling shy and a little awkward, is unsure how to decline Chixia's invitation to return to the city. Just when she is about to give in to Chixia's friendly insistence, you politely excuse both of you from the gathering. Chixia mentions she is also investigating the Tacet Discords that have been acting strangely. Just then, a loud noise nearby interrupts your conversation and you all decide to check it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After {PlayerName} and I bumped into each other, we decided to investigate the surroundings and follow Patroller Chixia to the scene of the incident.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was there we learned about the details of Mingyan's offense and the truth behind the tale of the Arcane Artist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Once Zhezhi has the paintbrush in her hand, she begins to speak calmly.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (She'll be fine making the statement on her own now.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After {PlayerName} and I bumped into each other, we decided to investigate the surroundings and follow Patroller Chixia to the scene of the incident.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was there we learned about the details of Mingyan's offense and the truth behind the tale of the Arcane Artist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Once Zhezhi has the paintbrush in her hand, she begins to speak calmly.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (She'll be fine making the statement on her own now.)

Chapters.Title: Find out about the strange TD activities

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zhezhi seems to be struggling to tell what she couldn't express earlier, but eventually stays silent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew... Sorry to trouble you, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why are you apologizing all of a sudden?
Don't worry about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks... Uh, wait, I haven't said why.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What I'm trying to say is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I had been clearer, you wouldn't have had to explain things to Chixia for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's really nice. It's just... we're not that close, and I'm not sure how to respond to how friendly she is... I didn't want to be rude, so I... I couldn't bring myself to turn her down.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's okay. I got you.
Her friendliness is infectious.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll do my best not to trouble you and express my feelings properly next time...

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm sure you will.
No trouble at all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then both of you decide to ask people around about the situation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Regretting her earlier hesitation, Zhezhi promises to speak up more decisively as you make your way to the scene.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks for your help, {PlayerName}! We caught the culprit before anything worse could happen... We were lucky to have you here!

Options.PlotLineKey: What was the cause of the incident?

Dialogues.Speaker: Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to the preliminary examination, we suspect that these Tacet Discords were agitated by the Frequency Fluctuations from a scroll painting found at the scene.

Dialogues.Speaker: Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The energy remaining in the painting was generated by its creator's Forte nearly overclocking.

Dialogues.Speaker: Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But rest assured, we've calmed her down and contained the energy.

Options.PlotLineKey: So she is the Arcane Artist.
It's a Forte. Just as I suspected...

Dialogues.Speaker: Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The painting needs to be thoroughly examined to identify its connection with the monsters and eliminate any potential risk it still poses.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks for all your help. We'll take it from here!

Options.PlotLineKey: What's the situation with the artist?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She fessed up when I first started talking to her, but clammed up when I tried to dig deeper.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... honestly, she seemed a bit off to me, but we don't have time for that now. We've got to clean up the scene and get the damage under control.

Options.PlotLineKey: Can I check on that painting later?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You sure can!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You learn from Chixia and a researcher that the Tacet Discords had gone wild due to a frequency fluctuation from a painting scroll found at the site. The scroll's power came from the artist's nearly Overclocked Forte.

Chapters.Title: Investigate the painting on the ground

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The painting becomes slightly blurry when you stare at it, and for a moment, the scene in it seems to come to life.
Why...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mingyan? Why are you...

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you know her?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, we used to take painting lessons together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You! I... I didn't...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I hurt them... it... it was a mistake...

Options.PlotLineKey: You mean... you hurt those people?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I'm alone...

Options.PlotLineKey: Why did you do this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mingyan appears to be done talking about the matter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While investigating Mingyan, the artist in question, you discover she had once studied art alongside Zhezhi. Although Mingyan's fragmented speech suggests that she may be guilty, her expression hints at a more complicated story. However, she is unwilling to reveal more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mingyan appears to be unwilling to talk with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My head... it hurts...

Options.PlotLineKey: Did you hear what that artist said?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only a bit. It looked like she was arguing with someone right before the weird visions appeared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard stuff like "Don't stop me!" "I've... I've already won!" and "Who doesn't want fame and fortune!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a good thing they caught that painter. Can't imagine what could've happened otherwise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've met my fair share of artists, but none that would gamble with lives for the sake of their work. That's a first for me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yinfeng, another witness, claimed that Mingyan created the dangerous painting purely for personal gain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Su
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank goodness I wasn't hurt. It was so close...

Options.PlotLineKey: Did you see what just happened?

Dialogues.Speaker: Su
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Part of it, I guess?

Options.PlotLineKey: Can you brief us on the situation?

Dialogues.Speaker: Su
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I saw that painter... She looked like she was losing it—I'm talking shouting, waving her paintbrush around like she was sweeping the sky!

Dialogues.Speaker: Su
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I might be off here, but I swear those things on her scroll started squirming around before the whole swarm of monsters exploded out of thin air...

Dialogues.Speaker: Su
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They started to whack and thwack people all over the place. I was terrified and ran away as fast as my legs would take me...

Options.PlotLineKey: Did you hear what she said?

Dialogues.Speaker: Su
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not super clearly, but when I was running for my life, I heard her screaming at all those creatures, all like "Stop! Don't do this!" I think she might've been trying to stop them from hurting people.

Options.PlotLineKey: A vivid description. Thanks for your help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From the witness Su, you learn that Mingyan appeared lost, waving her paintbrush moments before a swarm of Tacet Discords emerged from nowhere. It also seemed like she had tried to stop the monsters from harming anyone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's strange... Eh? Oh, {PlayerName}, you're back.

Options.PlotLineKey: I think I've figured out the truth behind the Arcane Artist tale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Y-you've figured it out already?

Options.PlotLineKey: I checked out that painting.
I talked to the witnesses.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The painting blurs the line between reality and illusion, causing whoever sees it to experience hallucinations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They repeatedly describe witnessing bizarre, otherwordly visions.

Options.PlotLineKey: The researcher indicated they were created by the artist's Forte.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... Mingyan channeled her Forte into the painting, creating temporary phantasms.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People saw her abilities and spread the rumor, believing she was the Arcane Artist from the tale.

Options.PlotLineKey: And the Tacet Discords were being drawn to her Forte.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The monsters described in the rumors were probably just exaggerated phantasms seen by scared people at night.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In fact, I had sensed something odd at the mine. But after we met, I thought it was coming from you, so I didn't give it much attention.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come to think of it now, it might've been Mingyan's Forte fluctuation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So she was there at the same time we were... I didn't even notice her presence...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... what could have driven her to create such dangerous paintings?

Options.PlotLineKey: One witness said she probably did this for personal gain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From what I know of her, she doesn't seem like someone who would take such risks for personal gain.

Options.PlotLineKey: Any leads on your end?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She kept squeezing my hand and trying to tell me something, but I couldn't understand what she was saying...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think she wants me to continue the investigation. Maybe there's more to this story than I thought...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, I don't recall her having a Forte before...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe this has something to do with me...

Options.PlotLineKey: Count me in.
It's linked to my case as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? A-are you sure? I definitely won't say no to your help! Actually, I... I've wanted it since we last met at the mine!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then... if you're up for it, I hope you can join me in the investigation. Consider it a formal invitation, {PlayerName}!

Options.PlotLineKey: Where should we start from?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You want me to decide? To be honest, I haven't really thought it through...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... I remember meeting Mingyan in an art studio in Jinzhou before. I wonder if she kept going there after I left...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should that be our first stop? She may have left some of her artwork behind. That could be a good start...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've never tried to investigate anything, so I'm not sure if this is the way to go...

Options.PlotLineKey: I think it is. After you, then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, let's go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After piecing together the clues, you uncover the truth. Mingyan used her Forte to create temporary phantasms in her art that attracted Tacet Discords. The "monsters" reported by witnesses were merely distorted phantasms seen by frightened people in the dark. Zhezhi insists that Mingyan was not motivated by personal gain, and asks that you continue to search for evidence to clear her name in her art studio.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After learning about the details of the assault, we decided to push forward with the investigation to get to the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pointless! The witnesses on the scene made it clear that it was all because of Mingyan's greedy ambition that she...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I haven't finished my statement, Mr. Baici!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After learning about the details of the assault, we decided to push forward with the investigation to get to the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pointless! The witnesses on the scene made it clear that it was all because of Mingyan's greedy ambition that she...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I haven't finished my statement, Mr. Baici!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, this is the art studio. My memory did serve me right. Looks like she's been painting here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's find the clues.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some pieces of paper are put beside the desk. They appear to be softer and lighter than ordinary paper.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This paper...

Options.PlotLineKey: Anything wrong?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This "White Jade Paper" has a rich history. Its smooth, fine texture holds ink beautifully, exactly what you want for more delicate brushwork.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Countless masterpieces, both old and new, were painted on this paper. Like Qinan's "Voyage to Yun Mountain" and Yilin's "Qixi's Dawn of Spring," both two good examples.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oops, I got carried away... Wait... there's a discount sticker on the wrapping, and it looks quite new...

Options.PlotLineKey: Discount?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, White Jade Hall runs a yearly sale. I attended it two days ago and bought paper with this same packaging.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mingyan likely bought her paper there too... Half of the stock has already been used, which means she was painting day and night until the incident.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's amazing that you can tell the difference.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Different papers result in different artistic effects. Real artists can always spot these differences, and choose the right paper to showcase various styles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: White Jade Paper is my absolute favorite, but because it's so expensive, I can only afford to buy it when there's a special sale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't pass up a great deal, so I stock up whenever I can. It usually takes a whole day to carry all the boxes home, but I must say... it's worth it!

Options.PlotLineKey: How do you know so much?!
I can help you carry the boxes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Buy three, get one free; buy five, get two free; and then there's the additional weekly coupons—I know everything there is to know about the discounts! Hehe...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? Then... I'll count on you next time!

Options.PlotLineKey: How did you know about Mingyan's habits?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have the same painting style, and the quality of our finished works is remarkably similar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if we use different brush techniques, our similar styles mean we should finish a painting in about the same time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once a painter holds a paintbrush in their hand, they won't stop until every detail meets their standards. It becomes an obsession... I guess this is true for most painters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In Mingyan's studio, you discovered pieces of "White Jade Paper." Zhezhi introduces its unique qualities with an artist's keen eye. Drawing from her understanding of the paper and Mingyan's habits, Zhezhi begins to build a theory about what happened prior to Mingyan's incident.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She painted so many...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zhezhi stands stunned before the painting. Words hover on her lips, yet remain unspoken.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why do these paintings all look the same...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is a difference. The brushwork on this one, see how heavy it is? You can tell Mingyan was in low spirits. And this one, the strokes are light and fluid. That tells me she was happy when she painted this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The feelings a painter has during the process of creation often linger in the brushstrokes without them knowing. They're present in every line, even if the artist tries to hide it.

Options.PlotLineKey: You can understand the painter's feelings through their work?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. To me, painting is like a window into the heart of the artist. When words fail, these feelings can be depicted through brushstrokes instead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is strange, though. She keeps reproducing the same painting over and over... using techniques that aren't her usual style.

Options.PlotLineKey: Something's written on the painting. Waters and... what is this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Waters and mountains rest by the pane, valleys and peaks in the dream remain. Colors of vanity washed away. The painted world fades, forgotten today."

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This artwork is titled "Serenity of Xiehua Village." It captures the scenic landscapes seen from the village itself...

Options.PlotLineKey: Wait, your clothes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, the pigment! When did it get on my clothes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? It came off with just a little wipe... Hmm... It shouldn't come off the fabric so easily...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Among Mingyan's drafts, Zhezhi recognizes copies of the "Serenity of Xiehua Village," each painted in subtly different ways. As you examine the details, Zhezhi notices pigment stains on her clothes and quickly realizes that the quality of the paint is lower than usual.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You see an old garment, tinged with stains.

Options.PlotLineKey: The colors look unusual.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Looks like they're stains from ink and paint that have been washed out over time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mingyan could have improvised her clothing as... a canvas for her ideas?

Options.PlotLineKey: How did you know this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I used to do this as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whenever nature inspired me and I was short on paper, I'd paint rough outlines onto my clothes.

Options.PlotLineKey: That's new to me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After all, fabric used to be a common art material. Besides, using clothes does help to seize fleeting inspiration, don't you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a shame the clothes are stained forever, but it's worth it to see how different inks behave on fabric.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A find a stained piece of clothing, prompting Zhezhi to recall how she used to use her clothing as makeshift canvases. She suggests that Mingyan might have done something similar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How could this happen...

Options.PlotLineKey: It seems she hit a bottleneck during her creation.
It seems she's copying someone else's artwork.
What is this Shanyun Art Exchange?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why there are so many copies of the original artwork.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I have some other thoughts about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Shanyun Art Exchange is a renowned institution that manages the exchange of calligraphy and paintings in Huanglong. For an artist to have their work selected is a great honor, bringing with it immense prestige.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to Mingyan's diary, the Art Exchange had been collaborating with her... until some terrible mishap occurred...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I have some other thoughts about it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Being picky about one's work is second nature to an artist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm no exception... There's never been a moment when I saw my art outshining someone else's. I've always admired my fellow artists, hoping that one day I could be as good as them, perhaps even surpass them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I kept painting and improving, but no matter how hard I tried, I always felt it wasn't good enough...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "This needs to be refined, it's not quite there yet..." "Still short of perfect... Will my client be disappointed?"

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I had these kinds of thoughts every day while I painted. It started creeping into my daily life too...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's true that one might find motivation in these thoughts, but they can also lead one astray.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I felt trapped for ages... until I finally figured out the path I ought to follow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Embrace my emotions fully, and create the art my heart yearns for. This is of the greatest importance to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if I found myself in the same situation as Mingyan, perhaps... perhaps I'd react similarly and lose my way...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She was forced into this and was looking for a way out... I can't just turn a blind eye and let them charge her! There must be a way to uncover the truth and save her.

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, we should continue our investigation now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You find Mingyan's notes that reveal her struggles as an artist and the pressure she felt while painting against her true desires. Zhezhi reflects on how common this feeling is among creators. Having once faced the same confusion, Zhezhi expresses her determination to uncover the truth and help save Mingyan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey {PlayerName}, have a look at this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems like this pigment is homemade... but why are there herbs in it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did she use a new recipe I'm not familiar with...

Options.PlotLineKey: It doesn't look like a pigment. More like the medicinal herb residue to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Medicinal herb residue?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She must have been making medicinal remedies recently. This must be the leftover residue she didn't get around to cleaning up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These herbs were used for medicine... Oh, so those plants I saw in the pharmacy weren't just for decoration!

Options.PlotLineKey: ...Haven't you seen someone brewing this before?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I've never tried myself... When I get sick, I usually just wait it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My family always brought me remedies and soups. I never thought about how they were made...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry... I'm just not very experienced.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You stumble upon medicinal herb residue. Zhezhi, inexperienced with such materials, initially thinks it is just leftover pigment. Finding this makes you realize that Mingyan had not been feeling well before the incident.

Chapters.Title: Investigate the vase fragments on the ground

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fragments of a vase scatter across the floor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The scrolls and papers are in disarray, as if they've been rummaged through.

Options.PlotLineKey: What happened here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think... Hmm... No, I might be wrong...

Options.PlotLineKey: What are you thinking?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing, it's just a thought. I might be wrong.

Options.PlotLineKey: This is a discussion, there is no right and wrong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then... I'll share it with you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The vase must've been on that cabinet, judging by where it fell.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Looks like the cabinet used to be over there, but... something bumped into it, and that's why the vase got knocked over.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I bet the water on the floor is from the fishbowl... Huh? Why is that water mark in the shape of a Gulpuff...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Okay, I've figured it out! That must be the reason. {PlayerName} will definitely be impressed with my deductive skills.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Gulpuff jumped out of the fishbowl, knocking over the vase and causing it to shatter on the floor. Then it landed on a pile of paintings. Realizing it was in trouble and afraid of getting scolded, it slipped out of the window.

Options.PlotLineKey: Who keeps Gulpuffs as pets?
What a... creative deduction.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah? Why wouldn't they?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My family used to have an aquarium at home with lots of Gulpuffs. I thought it was a popular trend...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, I need to improve my investigation skills...

Options.PlotLineKey: It is a logical explanation.
It's okay. You just need more clues.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that so? I-I'll practice more often!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see... I guess I jumped to conclusions. I'll do better next time!

Options.PlotLineKey: By the way, was that your Forte just now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, yes, these are... phantasms I can create with my brush. They only exist for a short while.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I haven't done this for a long time. I'm a bit rusty now...

Options.PlotLineKey: Haven't done this for a long time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I rarely need to use my Forte in daily life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When it comes to painting, I prefer the traditional way. It helps me to understand my progress and improve my skills.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An artwork created with Forte is indeed mesmerizing, nearly flawless, but that's not my goal...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, I've used this ability less over time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it's fine to use it for the investigation.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you think Mingyan's case has something to do with you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. It could be related to my Forte...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zhezhi seems a bit upset and unwilling to continue this topic.

Options.PlotLineKey: We'll talk about this later. Let's look outside now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zhezhi speculates that a Gulpuff might have escaped from the studio. While the theory seems questionable, you appreciate her effort, spurring Zhezhi to try again. Impressed by her Forte use, you learn that Zhezhi rarely uses her Resonance abilities. Zhezhi confesses that her Forte, which closely resembles Mingyan's, may somehow be connected to Mingyan's uncharacteristic outburst.

Chapters.Title: Investigate the clues outside the studio

Options.PlotLineKey: Someone left these tracks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mmhmm.

Options.PlotLineKey: They could be the missing piece in our theory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Someone broke into the studio looking for something... or trying to steal something? Probably something tied to Mingyan's paintings...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, they were startled by something unexpected and, in their panic to escape through the window, collided with the cabinet, causing the vase to fall.

Options.PlotLineKey: That makes more sense now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This might be related to the Shanyun Art Exchange and Mingyan's breakdown... Let's follow these tracks and see where they lead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The clues from the studio led us to an Exiles' camp.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There, we found new clues that pointed to a hidden player behind all of this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The clues from the studio led us to an Exiles' camp.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There, we found new clues that pointed to a hidden player behind all of this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some ore residues are scattered beside the trolley, with color stains on it.

Options.PlotLineKey: Looks like pigments...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The trolley is worn... Maybe it carried something very heavy.

Options.PlotLineKey: Maybe the Exiles used it to transport ore and pigments.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could it be they transported ore, made pigments from them, and then moved the pigments elsewhere?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could the buyers Mr. Shilang mentioned be the ones who stole the ore?

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's see if we can find the evidence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A large pile of fragmented ores is mixed with the pigment, unmarked and unpackaged.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Scarletthorn, Indigoite, and other ore... these match the raw materials for pigments listed on Mr. Shilang's transaction record.

Options.PlotLineKey: Seems you're right.
They're the ones who bought the leftover ore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I took a look and noticed that these pigments were handcrafted from these specific ores...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Standard pigments adhere well and last a long time, but these makeshift pigments smear with the slightest touch.

Options.PlotLineKey: That sounds familiar.
Was the pigment in Mingyan's studio the same as this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I did mention this back in the studio... when my clothes got stained by Mingyan's pigments.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did she... buy these low-quality pigments from the Exiles? But why did these people break into her studio...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They are similar. Did she... buy these low-quality pigments from the Exiles? But why did these people break into her studio...

Options.PlotLineKey: Someone's coming this way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At an Exile camp, you find piles of ore fragments and handmade pigments. The amount perfectly matches what you saw in Shilang's transaction records. This confirms that these Exiles were the ore thieves and that Mingyan had purchased their low-quality pigments.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who are you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Er, h-hello... we are...

Options.PlotLineKey: We're here for Mingyan's painting. She's our friend.
We want to buy paintings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If it's her paintings you're after, why are you here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She... she wasn't in her studio, so we thought we could ask around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Just wait for her here. When she leaves, it usually doesn't take long for her to return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're here to buy paintings? That's not how this works. Go on, get out of here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-we are actually here for Mingyan's paintings. She wasn't in her studio, so we thought we could ask around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Okay then, my bad.

Options.PlotLineKey: What did you mean just now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...It's nothing. Just wait for her here. When she leaves, it usually doesn't take long for her to return.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you know her？

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Know her? We go way back. She's... okay in our books. Though she hasn't had the easiest run either, she helped us out a while back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Guess you could call us friends. She even gifted us a painting. It's somewhere around here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, here it is! We're no fancy connoisseurs, but even we can tell that girl can paint!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I kind of like it, myself. It's lively, bright... Almost like you can touch the freedom and joy she felt painting it.

Options.PlotLineKey: Did something happen to her recently?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can't recall anything noteworthy...

Dialogues.Speaker: Candid Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My guess? She's dabbling in some new, secretive art piece. I spotted her taking risky stabs at painting out in the wild.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, now that you mention it, I do remember her talking about making art you could "step into" or whatever.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But her little art excursions stirred up some unstable Frequencies. We warned her, but did she listen? Nope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chatty Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right! I saw her paintings myself! Tried to steer her clear, and what do I get? A lecture! Artists, always on their own wild wavelength, aren't they?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry to interrupt, but mind if I ask what you normally do for a living?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Us? Oh, the usual. A bit of hunting, some gigs here and there. Just the everyday grind.

Options.PlotLineKey: Anything else?
You don't buy ore to make your own pigments?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nope, not many jobs around, just enough to scrape by.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh... Oh! Right, haha, you reminded me. We do make and sell pigments occasionally.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chatty Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh yeah, Mingyan buys from us often. We give her the lowest price, just as friends do!

Options.PlotLineKey: I see. Thank you. We'll leave now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Exiles admit to knowing Mingyan and admiring her exceptional art. They claim they tried to stop her from creating dangerous paintings, but their efforts had been in vain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have an idea.

Options.PlotLineKey: Did you wanna say something just now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. I think... neither these Exiles nor Mingyan has told the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I noticed some of the Exiles' hands were blackened... The thought suddenly hit me, what if it's from constant exposure to ink?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If so, they must be making a lot of pigments and ink sticks...

Options.PlotLineKey: But they lied to us and tried to cover it up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The painting they showed us and the artworks in the studio... they all match what Mingyan described in her diary.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her diary shows us she had major mood swings, which really affected her art.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All these strange things... started happening after the Shanyun Art Exchange got involved.

Options.PlotLineKey: We can investigate the camp again tonight. What do you say?
Maybe there's more they're trying to hide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good idea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Makes sense.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You two patiently wait until night falls.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zhezhi senses that neither the Exiles nor Mingyan are being truthful. She notices that some Exiles have blackened hands, a sign they are secretly producing pigments and inks for some unknown purpose. Suspicious of their deception, you decide to sneak into the camp at night to uncover the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hear people talking.

Options.PlotLineKey: We can eavesdrop on their conversation.
[Enter combat] Let's beat the truth out of them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: OK, I'll use my Terminal to record it, just in case.

Dialogues.Speaker: Candid "Exile"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, Mr. Baici stopped by again, grumbling about the delay in getting Mingyan's paintings to the Shanyun Art Exchange...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic "Exile"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If Yinfeng hadn't pushed her, she wouldn't have gotten hurt. Now she can't even paint, and our order is gonna be late.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, watch yourself. I just did what I always do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's been rebellious and a bit too smart for her own good lately. I just wanted her to keep her head down and work. Who knew she'd crack and cause that mess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Luckily, I slipped away, and the Patrollers didn't suspect me... No big deal. I pinned it all on Mingyan, so we're in the clear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic "Exile"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone was here earlier asking about her case. No Patrollers, but... Do you think they could find out what we did?

Dialogues.Speaker: Candid "Exile"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Doubtful. They might notice we're making pigments here, but that's it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It doesn't matter if they find out. We pose as Exiles, and what doesn't an Exile do?

Dialogues.Speaker: Candid "Exile"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But we should be careful. Remember what Mr. Baici warned us about? Keep these things on the down low, and if anyone finds out, they can't be allowed to trace it back to the Shanyun Art Exchange.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: During your infiltration, you overhear a conversation revealing that these supposed Exiles are actually employees of the Shanyun Art Exchange. This confirms that the Art Exchange is involved in Mingyan's plight and hints at their involvement in churning out art forgeries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who's there!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: T-they saw us!

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should go before anyone else spots us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So this Shanyun Art Exchange has been involved in Mingyan's case right from the start.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No wonder they got all shifty when we brought up Mingyan earlier...

Options.PlotLineKey: Masquerading as Exiles is indeed cunning.
Yinfeng... The name sounds familiar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yinfeng... Yes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was his signature on Mr. Shilang's transaction record.

Options.PlotLineKey: We spoke right where it happened.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I asked him about the incident, he put all the blame on Mingyan, saying she had ulterior motives.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Exiles we questioned during the day did the same, trying to divert attention and cover up their own involvement at the scene in the first place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These distractions led us to concentrate solely on Mingyan, ignoring other possible angles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have a theory... but we need that "batch of paintings" they mentioned to test it...

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's give the area another sweep.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But there are so many more people in the camp now! How should we get in?

Options.PlotLineKey: We'll walk right in.
We'll disguise ourselves as Exiles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They might hide all the evidence if we barge in like that...

Options.PlotLineKey: Then we'll just have to "blend in."

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the Exile clothing in hand, the two of you quickly change into your disguises.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From their conversation, you discover that Yinfeng, the witness from the crime scene, had signed Shilang's transaction record. Yinfeng had framed Mingyan to cover up their illegal activities. To verify Zhezhi's suspicions about a certain "batch of paintings" mentioned in the Exiles' conversation, you decide to disguise yourselves and investigate further.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who the hell are you?! Coming at us like this... Think you can just push around Exiles, huh?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Candid "Exile"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's them! They were here asking about Mingyan earlier today!

Options.PlotLineKey: What were you saying just now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic "Exile"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who do you think you are?! We don't need to tell you a thing!

Options.PlotLineKey: We just want the truth of Mingyan's case.
(Draw your sword)

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-wait a second! Things don't need to get violent! We'll talk, okay?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: About Mingyan... Didn't my men answer your questions already? That's everything we've got on her, I swear. What more do you want?

Options.PlotLineKey: Spill the truth or we won't let you go.
(Draw your sword)

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, alright! I'll tell you everything!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cryptic "Exile"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yinfeng! We aren't supposed to...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? Can't you see that we're no match for {Male=him;Female=her}? Go ahead and pick a fight if you want, but I'm not risking my life for this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now what else do you want to know? Just ask!

Options.PlotLineKey: Did Mingyan get hurt because of you?
Why are you really making pigments and ink sticks?
Are you with the Shanyun Art Exchange?
I've nothing else to ask.

Dialogues.Speaker: Candid "Exile"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If Yinfeng hadn't pushed her so hard, she wouldn't have gotten hurt. Now, she can't even pick up a paintbrush, much less finish this batch of paintings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, quick to sell me out, huh? All I did was remind her to focus on her paintings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's been rebellious and a bit too smart for her own good lately. I just wanted her to keep her head down and work. Who knew she'd crack and cause that mess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To cut our costs and keep our cooperation with the painters going. What else could it be?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We... we're with the Shanyun Art Exchange. We're only pretending to be Exiles because our boss, Mr. Baici, wants this business kept quiet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Candid "Exile"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You shouldn't have told them! Mr. Baici said no one can find out about the Art Exchange's involvement, no matter what!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You just can't stop talking back, can you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So the Shanyun Art Exchange has been involved in Mingyan's case right from the start.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No wonder they got all shifty when we brought up Mingyan earlier...

Options.PlotLineKey: Masquerading as Exiles is indeed cunning.
Yinfeng... the name sounds familiar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yinfeng... Yes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was his signature on Mr. Shilang's transaction record.

Options.PlotLineKey: We spoke right where it happened.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I asked him about the incident, he put all the blame on Mingyan, saying she had ulterior motives.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Exiles we questioned during the day did the same, trying to divert attention and cover up their own involvement at the scene in the first place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These distractions led us to concentrate solely on Mingyan, ignoring other possible angles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
