Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have a theory... but we need that "batch of paintings" they mentioned to test it...

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's give the area another sweep.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But there are so many more people in the camp now! How will we get in?

Options.PlotLineKey: We'll walk right in.
We'll disguise ourselves as Exiles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They might hide all the evidence if we barge in like that...

Options.PlotLineKey: Then we'll just have to "blend in."

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Why are you staring at me? Wait, I've told you everything I know! Aaargh—

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the Exile clothing in hand, the two of you quickly change into your disguises.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: During your infiltration, you overhear a conversation revealing that these supposed Exiles are actually employees of the Shanyun Art Exchange. This confirms that the Art Exchange is involved in Mingyan's plight and hints at their involvement in churning out art forgeries. You also learn that Yinfeng, the witness from the crime scene, had signed Shilang's transaction record. Yinfeng had framed Mingyan to cover up their illegal activities. To verify Zhezhi's suspicions about a certain "batch of paintings" mentioned in the Exiles' conversation, you decide to disguise yourselves and investigate further.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's quite the story. At best, this merely proves our involvement in the incident at best, yet the real culprit remains unknown. Your accusations are groundless.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Allow me to remind you, she was the one who created those paintings, insisted on selling them, and concocted the entire terrifying incident.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you honestly believe her paintings would've earned a single penny without my intervention?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... Mr. Baici, you're changing the subject.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How ungrateful. She ensnared us in this debacle, and now you dare to lay the blame at our feet?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: B-Before we proceed, I wish to present this audio recording to the court.

Dialogues.Speaker: Recording Playback
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Ugh, Mr. Baici stopped by again, grumbling about the delay in getting Mingyan's paintings to the Shanyun Art Exchange..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Recording Playback
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "If Yinfeng hadn't pushed her, she wouldn't have gotten hurt. Now she can't even paint, and our order is gonna be late."

Dialogues.Speaker: Recording Playback
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "She's been rebellious and a bit too smart for her own good lately. I just wanted her to keep her head down and work. Who knew she'd crack and cause that mess."

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mingyan was initially only making copies. Everything changed after you stepped in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Trickery, misinformation, and later on even threats... She was led down the path of forging artworks for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I do understand that... if her own heart hadn't wavered, none of this would've happened... But there was already no turning back by the time she wanted to quit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, saying she was the mastermind behind it all... that's just not fair.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even so, how is forgery a valid accusation? Nothing like that was mentioned in your recording, now was it?

Options.PlotLineKey: We found the original painting in the hidden warehouse.
We found evidence of forgeries being bought and sold.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This evidence clearly shows that these paintings are no ordinary copies, but your way of making a profit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, there's no such thing as real or fake paintings. You're not fooling anyone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For it to be forgery, there has to be another original artist. These paintings are all the work of Mingyan. Even if she made dozens of identical copies, it wouldn't be considered forgery.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Mr. Baici, do you recognize this painting?

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, of course. It's "Serenity of Xiehua Village," the work of the Arcane Artist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then can you tell the difference between this one and the others?

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course, this piece possesses a lifelike quality unmatched by any other, all thanks to the Resonance ability of the Arcane Artist—Mingyan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, judging from these paintings, it seems Mingyan's ability never stabilized successfully, except for this original piece.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What does this have to do with anything? Do you have solid evidence to prove the differences between these paintings?

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What you're saying is all speculation. There's no guarantee a painter won't make mistakes, is there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Artists seeking perfection always choose the highest quality pigments for their most important pieces.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: During our investigation of the studio, I accidentally got paint on me and discovered something interesting about the materials used in these paintings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The original paintings had pigments that were purer and brighter, able to blend more naturally and retain color for longer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In contrast, the forgeries used pigments made from mineral scraps. These don't hold up the same, smudging at the slightest touch.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can distinguish the real paintings from the fakes simply by analyzing the ink used.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Doing so only proves the so-called "original painting" is created differently from the others. Are you implying that Mingyan is only allowed to use a single kind of pigment throughout her work?

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How is this supposed to prove that we are behind the forgeries?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because the original creator of "Serenity in Xiehua Village" is me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the hearing, you present the evidence—the recording, art forgeries, and the low-quality pigments—to prove how the Art Exchange coerced painters into producing counterfeit works. However, Baici defends himself with different excuses. At that moment, Zhezhi gathers her courage and reveals a hidden truth: she is the original creator of "Serenity of Xiehua Village."

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I was a child, painting was the only way I could express myself freely.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything I did and didn't understand... it all flowed through the tip of my paintbrush.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All that I saw, lived within my paintings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whatever I thought, I painted into reality.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This power to turn fantasies into reality gradually caught the interest of many.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tales of the Arcane Artist spread far and wide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I took great joy in my skills improving, however...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I discovered, to my dismay, that my parents were using my creations to turn a quick profit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They were sold at unbelievable prices.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some sought beauty in enchanted worlds...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Using the paintings as a distraction from reality.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Others resorted to hellish nightmares...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To inflict torment upon those they desire.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My own abilities had led my paintings astray.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They were being exploited, and everything was spiraling out of control.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After I realized this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I began to fear holding a brush.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I tried to paint without relying on my abilities, but...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My parents scolded me for it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They called anything painted without using my abilities worthless.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After the family business fell apart, my parents vanished without a trace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They may have left behind a considerable mess...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But freedom has also been returned to my brush.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Xiehua Village was my first stop upon arriving in Jinzhou alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Waters and mountains rest by the pane, valleys and peaks in the dream remain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Colors of vanity washed away; the painted world fades, forgotten today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A poem I wrote, inscribed on "Serenity in Xiehua Village."

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know it's not that well-written.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it's proof of my decision to stop everything I was doing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And that painting, well... it became the "Arcane Artist's" final piece of art.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ever since that day...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Paintings with special abilities gradually faded from everyone's minds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I never used my abilities to paint again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baici
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, that was certainly a touching story. But I'm afraid your words alone won't be enough to prove you created this painting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Madam Juyao, to prove my statement, I request your permission to use and paint with one of these copies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Juyao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Granted.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you sure you want to do this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Mingyan's experience has made me realize something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To create art that truly resonates, I must first accept myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The paintings I drew in the past... they were heartfelt creations, pieces of my life. They formed my past and shaped who I am today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not just about proving a single painting... it's about so much more...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If my Forte is the cause behind all this, then I must take responsibility... I can't just let this go on and hurt others.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zhezhi faces her past and takes control of her Forte, preparing to use it to back up her claim and embrace the responsibility that comes with her talent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuqing
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So the rumors are true...

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianzhang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Th-these paintings are really coming to life?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Woyun
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's happening?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why is the world inside this painting so distorted?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Spectacle is born from the mind."

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This place must be a manifestation of Mingyan's mind when she created it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, did you hear something?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zhezhi?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan's Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan's Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've painted it exactly like hers...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan's Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So why is everyone still praising her work...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That voice...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan's Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's all right. It's okay, she's gone now. Soon... I'll be an even better painter than she ever was!

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan's Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... It's you... I've already done everything I can... Why are you still better than me?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan's Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You were just lucky... If it weren't for your parents holding your hands... You'd never have what should be rightfully mine!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan's Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still... I couldn't do it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan's Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why... I perfected everything...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan's Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's all because of your abilities...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My abilities have nothing to do with it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You created masterpieces I wish came from me. Bold, free...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know our paintings have their differences, but the heart and soul we put into them are the same.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You shouldn't see me as a model to follow...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only when you connect with your truest feelings can you create an exceptional piece of art!

Chapters.Title: Return to the Public Security Bureau

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I learned the truth, I was heartbroken...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believed that by sealing my Forte, no one would get hurt because of my paintings. I never expected them to continue causing harm after all these years.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But {PlayerName}'s words made me realize something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was never about the paintings themselves, but rather those who sought to use them to hurt others.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Baici, you run a highly esteemed calligraphy and painting institution, yet you've suppressed the creative spirit and violated these artists' dignity, all for the sake of wealth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything they cherished has now become a tool for profit... The works they held dear are just tools for your gain, insulting to both the original artists and their imitators.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Set before you is the original painting from many years ago and the one I've just completed. Now, everything has been brought to light.

Dialogues.Speaker: Juyao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We received word from the Public Security Bureau ten minutes ago that they have taken the Exiles into custody and found the location where the paintings were hidden.

Dialogues.Speaker: Juyao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Baici, do you have anything else to add to your defense?

Dialogues.Speaker: Juyao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very well. We will re-evaluate Mingyan's charges, determine the Shanyun Art Exchange's involvement in the incident, and conduct a comprehensive investigation as soon as possible.

Dialogues.Speaker: Juyao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This hearing is adjourned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The painting Zhezhi creates during the hearing, combined with the message you sent to the Patrollers, leaves Baici no choice but to confess. The Public Security Bureau announces they will re-evaluate Mingyan's charges and launch a full investigation. Victory is yours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's finally over... I didn't miss anything important, did I?

Options.PlotLineKey: You did great.
You hid your nerves well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? No, not at all... I was just coming up with things to say as I went. My palms were sweating the whole time...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I definitely couldn't have done it if you weren't there with me... Thinking about the feeling when we were investigating the case together is what kept me calm during the trial.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wh-what I meant to say is, back then, everything I said felt right, like I could just be myself around you. It felt so good to be that relaxed...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for helping me through this. You... you helped me find the courage to believe in myself. Thanks to you, look at everything we accomplished.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Shanyun Art Exchange is undergoing investigation. It'll be the end of their businesses... And the painters they coerced are finally set free.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, {PlayerName}. I haven't felt this happy in a long time!

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't mention it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to pay Mingyan a visit. After all, she was involved in all of this, and I want to tell her everything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you think?

Options.PlotLineKey: Can I come with you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My commission started with her, plus you and I solved the case together. Why don't you come with me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is the commission over?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I already had it taken care of the day we found out the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All right, let's go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After the hearing, Zhezhi thanks you for your unwavering support and expresses her relief at the outcome. Together, you plan to visit Mingyan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zhezhi... It's been a while.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your injuries...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The researchers have taken good care of me. A chat won't hurt. And you must be... the Rover?

Options.PlotLineKey: You know me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard about everything you did. Thank you for freeing me from those nightmares.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know what, Zhezhi? You may seem soft and gentle on the outside, but if your boundaries are crossed, I think you can be tougher than anyone else.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And... I still owe you an apology.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forgive me. Because I was so obsessed with wanting to be you... to be better than you, I've caused you so much trouble...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...The pain of these injuries managed to put a stop to my obsession with imitating your paintings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh. Maybe... I was never meant to be a painter to begin with...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I brought you a gift...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mingyan accepts a scroll of painting from Zhezhi, staring at it for a long time after opening it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, see...? Only you can create a painting with such life. I still have a long way to go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is your painting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the one you gave me when we first met.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... Hehe... How ironic. I've been trying to imitate you for so many years that now I can't even tell my own paintings apart anymore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your paintings were never inferior to mine. Just look at this piece, even you approve of its value. It doesn't matter who painted it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mingyan, I hope you can find your true self, whoever she is. I know you can do it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mingyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Thank you for bringing me this painting... Really.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mingyan opens the scroll painting once again and stares at every detail for a long time. She appears lost in thought. Zhezhi and you leave quietly after seeing this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When Mingyan learns about your efforts, she expresses her deep gratitude and apologizes to Zhezhi. She admits that the incident makes her question whether she is truly meant to be an artist. Zhezhi encourages her to follow her heart, gifting her a painting she had once received from Mingyan. Staring at her own work, Mingyan grows emotional, lost in thought.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think it's safe to say she'll give it some thought.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: During the few times we met, she was always passionate about discussing art with me. I think that fire inside her won't just fade away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come to think of it, the deep discussions we had and the painting duels back then felt like true friendship.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... seeing her in so much pain, I just had to help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't want Mingyan to lose hope and have someone who loves painting so much just disappear...

Options.PlotLineKey: I think she understood what you meant earlier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To be honest, I didn't just see this case through to correct mistakes or help the artists. Deep down, I...I didn't want to let you down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wanted to tell you this back at the mine, but the words just didn't come out right...

Options.PlotLineKey: It's fine, I understand what you're trying to say.
I'm glad you finally said it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for being my friend and helping me through all of this, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: I can say the same to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While I have yet to uncover my past and who I am, every moment with you is a new and special memory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for your help, Zhezhi. This experience has helped me understand you and the world a little better.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You seem to be pretty slow on the news, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: So you know how to tell jokes now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe... You've given me the courage to joke around.

Options.PlotLineKey: Does that mean you can do the same in front of others?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... well...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's take it slow for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Happy for Mingyan's change of heart, Zhezhi tells you that solving this case isn't just about helping Mingyan, but also about living up to your expectations. Touched by your reassurance, Zhezhi playfully teases you for the first time. While it may still be difficult for her to open up around others, she has made great strides thanks to your support.
